title: The particles on Taric's new skins need to be recoloured.
body:
Now I know the skins are on PBE which means that particles are not final. However, Riot did not mention anything about the particles on Emerald or AotFA Taric actually changing. I know they're not expensive skins, but since they're getting visually updated, you might as well give them the appropriate colours for their effects. 

For Emerald Taric, I know green probably wouldn't work for clarity purposes (healing spells are usually green) but I think they should be a somewhat lime/yellow colour. It would fit the skin perfectly. 

For AotFA Taric, just purple/pink. There's no reason not to have this. 

We're not asking for anything  flashy. Just simple recolours of the spells. I'm pretty sure you can do that, Riot.

replies.body: Please don't leave out the bloodstone taric skin. It just looks kinda awkward to have bloodstones shooting blue ish stuff and having a blue bastion gem appear on his w.

> [{quoted}](name=Fafhrd,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=yKgoemZV,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-04-06T17:43:37.230+0000)
>
> Please don't leave out the bloodstone taric skin. It just looks kinda awkward to have bloodstones shooting blue ish stuff and having a blue bastion gem appear on his w.

You're right, now that you mention it. Bloodstone Taric should probably get more particles than it has, given that it's a 975 RP skin.
Bloodstone Taric actually does have recolored particles. They are more red/blue which is in line with Bloodstone Lissandra.

I'm *sure* you guys can do a much better job of changing the colors on the Bastion. Because having it remain blue and white, in skins that have their primary colors as pink, green and gold, and black and red, it doesn't make any sense that all the Bastion particles are standard Taric's. And I don't believe you when you say they are changed. The stuns have different particles, but the art team seems to have dropped the ball on everything else.

Let me put it another way: You *know* you did something wrong when you changed something and people tell you they can't see the change. It feels so strange to play Emo Taric when my gem shields aren't any different from the base skin, and it feels even stranger when I'm told that they're *supposed* to be different.

It's probably for the same reason that they left the speed gate blue on Forsaken Jayce. 

Red Particles = Enemy

Blue Particles = Ally

Except the gem shroud has absolutely no clarity issues at all. If the shroud is on an ENEMY then obviously it's the ENEMY Taric's Bastion, not yours. It should not be difficult to understand unlike Forsaken Jayce's gate. The Bastion particles deserve noticeable changes across all of Taric's skins.
Hey i just watched the Bloodstone lissandra skin spotlight and its not blue. Its Red and Black. Which would be awesome on the taric skin. Just saying. ;)

Bloodstone on the other hand is 975RP and he actually does have unique some more unique skin effects(his gems are differently shaped for Q,his E and R have different designs),however his W doesn't seem to have new effects and he doesn't have a unique recall,which is kind of a bummer.
